body.raw:
# Colors FlexiUI provides a comprehensive color system based on semantic color tokens. ## Semantic Colors FlexiUI uses semantic color names for consistent theming: ### Primary Colors ```tsx ``` ### Status Colors ```tsx ``` ### Neutral Colors ```tsx ``` ## Color Palette The default color palette includes: - **primary**: Main brand color - **secondary**: Secondary brand color - **success**: Success states (#0cce6b) - **warning**: Warning states (#ffc107) - **error**: Error states (#f31260) - **default**: Neutral color ## Customizing Colors ### Via Provider Customize colors through the FlexiUIProvider: ```tsx import { FlexiUIProvider } from '@flexi-ui/react' const theme = { colors: { primary: '#0070f3', secondary: '#7928ca', success: '#0cce6b', warning: '#ffc107', error: '#f31260' } } function App() { return ( {/* Your app */} ) } ``` ### Via Tailwind Config Extend colors in your Tailwind configuration: ```js // tailwind.config.js module.exports = { theme: { extend: { colors: { primary: '#0070f3', secondary: '#7928ca' } } } } ``` ## Color Shades Each semantic color has light and dark variants: ```tsx
Primary
Primary 50%
Primary 20%
``` ## Background and Foreground FlexiUI uses content layers for backgrounds: ```tsx
Content 1
Content 2
Content 3
``` ## Text Colors Use foreground colors for text: ```tsx

Default text

Muted text

Primary text

``` ## Border Colors Apply colors to borders: ```tsx
Divider border
Primary border
``` ## Opacity Control color opacity: ```tsx
10% opacity
50% opacity
90% opacity
``` ## Dark Mode Colors automatically adjust for dark mode: ```tsx
Adapts to light/dark mode
```
